Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1502: What is A1502? A1502 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2014, Late 2013, Early 2015 with EMC 2875, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-3476, 820-3536, 820-4924..

threads.title: Macbook Pro 13 inch 2016 display issues? Another recall coming?
threads.message:
Hi Guys, I already have like 5 units with the same issue as described by my customer below:

"I have a problem with my MacBook. The screen suddenly became black and now it's still black. The computer is fine to plug into external monitor so I think just the screen is the problem.
Also the screen is fine if not open more than 30 degree angle so I suspect it's a connection problem."

Replacing the display fixes the issue but I am wondering what is the issue here, some sensor or cable crack issue? Anyone knows? It looks like its gonna be yet another recall for these pieces of crap.

threads.title: Macbook Pro 13 inch 2016 display issues? Another recall coming?
threads.message:
I see many A1502s with a faulty display cable.
Swap it out for one of the many smashed screens' ones and everything works again.

Might be the issue you're seeing.

threads.title: Macbook Pro 13 inch 2016 display issues? Another recall coming?
threads.message: For these 2016's I dont think we can change the cable its glued under the display, so a new display looks like the only solution. I know about the <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>'s these LVDS Cables are easy to replace.
